tool.name: Gdal_Warp
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py output_data_Result $output_data_Result name Gdal_Warp Format '$Format' InputDSN '$InputDSN' OutputDSN '$OutputDSN' s_srs '$s_srs' t_srs '$t_srs' tps $tps geoloc $geoloc rpc $rpc r $r order '$order' te '$te' prefer $prefer response $response transmissionMode_Result $OutputSection_Result.transmissionMode_Result

param.name: Format
param.label: Format of the output data
param.help: Select the output format by usig short name of the format (use gda-config --formats for list of available formats on your platform).

param.name: InputDSN
param.label: The input data source name
param.help: The input data source name to use as source for convertion.

param.name: OutputDSN
param.label: The output data source name
param.help: The output data source name to use as source for convertion.

param.name: s_srs
param.label: The source Spatial reference Set
param.help: The coordinate systems that can be passed are anything supported by the OGRSpatialReference.SetFromUserInput() call, which includes EPSG PCS and GCSes (ie. EPSG:4296), PROJ.4 declarations (as above), or the name of a .prf file containing well known text.

param.name: t_srs
param.label: The target Spatial reference Set
param.help: The coordinate systems that can be passed are anything supported by the OGRSpatialReference.SetFromUserInput() call, which includes EPSG PCS and GCSes (ie. EPSG:4296), PROJ.4 declarations (as above), or the name of a .prf file containing well known text.

param.name: tps
param.label: Thin Plate Spline
param.help: Force use of thin plate spline transformer based on available GCPs

param.name: r
param.label: Resampling method to use
param.help: Available methods are: near (nearest neighbour resampling - default, fastest algorithm, worst interpolation quality), bilinear, cubic, cubicspline, lanczos (Lanczos windowed sinc resampling)

param.name: order
param.label: The order of polynomial used for warping (1 to 3)
param.help: The default is to select a polynomial order based on the number of GCPs.

param.name: te
param.label: xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax
param.help: set georeferenced extents of output file to be created (in target SRS).

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_Result
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: The gdalwarp utility is an image mosaicing, reprojection and warping utility. The program can reproject to any supported projection, and can also apply GCPs stored with the image if the image is "raw" with control information.
